definition: donkey-hide gelatin (used in TCM)/Taiwan pr. [a1 jiao1]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
flatter
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
to glue/glue/gum/rubber

sentences.english: This is a view on the chemical composition and Pharmacological Function of Colla Corii Asini.
sentences.chinese: 本文綜述了中藥阿膠的化學成分及其藥理藥效作用。

sentences.english: The price of it has increased significantly, so this year we have to eat less.
sentences.chinese: 因爲阿膠的價格大幅上漲，所以今年我們只好少喫點。

sentences.english: Because the price of donkey-hide gelatin has increased significantly, this year we have to eat less.
sentences.chinese: 因爲阿膠的價格大幅上漲，所以今年我們只好少喫點。

sentences.english: The productivity of gelatin is largely conditioned by the shortage of donkey skin.
sentences.chinese: 制約阿膠產能不能實現突破的重要原因是驢皮緊張。

sentences.english: This paper reports the effects of Ejiao (Colla Corii Asini) on endotoxin shocks in dogs.
sentences.chinese: 本文報告了阿膠對狗內毒素性休克的治療作用。

turtle shell

(TCM) to build up one's kidney yang/to boost male sex drive
dodder (Cuscuta sinensis, a parasitic vine with seeds used in medicine)
ladybell root (Radix adenophorae)
King Solomon's seal (plant of genus Polygonatum)
mole cricket/Gryllolaptaptidae, family of burrowing insects of order Orthoptera (a serious agricultural pest)

eight-treasure decoction, tonic formula used in Chinese medicine
four-substance decoction (si wu tang), tonic formula used in Chinese medicine
